name: project-explorer_explore_project
description: Lists all files in a directory with their sizes and imports/exports. Analyzes JavaScript/TypeScript files for import/export statements and provides detailed file information including size formatting. Excludes common build directories like node_modules, .git, dist, etc.

subDirectory.description: Optional subdirectory within the main directory to analyze

includeHidden.description: Whether to include hidden files and directories (starting with .)

name: project-explorer_list_allowed_directories
description: Returns the list of directories that this MCP server is allowed to access. This is useful for understanding which directories can be explored or searched before attempting to use other tools. The allowed directories are configured when the server starts and cannot be modified at runtime.

name: project-explorer_search_files
description: Advanced file and code search tool with comprehensive filtering and matching capabilities. Searches for patterns in files within allowed directories with support for regex patterns, file type filtering, size constraints, date filtering, and content preprocessing. When called without arguments, searches for common patterns in the current directory. Supports excluding comments and string literals for cleaner code searches. Results can be formatted as text, JSON, or structured output with configurable sorting and grouping options.

pattern.description: Search pattern - can be literal text or regex depending on regexMode. Defaults to searching for common file types if not specified

searchPath.description: Directory path to search in. Must be within allowed directories. Defaults to first allowed directory if not specified

extensions.description: Array of file extensions to include (e.g., ['.js', '.ts', '.py']). Include the dot prefix

excludeExtensions.description: Array of file extensions to exclude

excludePatterns.description: Array of filename patterns to exclude (supports simple wildcards)

regexMode.description: Whether to treat pattern as a regular expression

caseSensitive.description: Whether search should be case sensitive

wordBoundary.description: Whether to match whole words only

multiline.description: Whether to enable multiline regex matching

maxDepth.description: Maximum directory recursion depth. Unlimited if not specified

includeBinary.description: Whether to search in binary files

modifiedAfter.description: Only include files modified after this date (ISO 8601 format)

modifiedBefore.description: Only include files modified before this date (ISO 8601 format)

snippetLength.description: Length of text snippet around matches

maxResults.description: Maximum number of match results to return

groupByFile.description: Whether to group results by file

excludeComments.description: Whether to exclude comments from search (language-aware)

excludeStrings.description: Whether to exclude string literals from search

name: project-explorer_rename_file
description: Rename or move a file or directory. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

oldPath.description: Current path of the file or directory to rename

newPath.description: New path for the file or directory

name: project-explorer_delete_file
description: Delete a file or directory. Use with extreme caution as this operation cannot be undone. When deleting directories, all contents will be permanently removed. The recursive option must be explicitly set to true to delete non-empty directories. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: Path to the file or directory to delete

recursive.description: Set to true to delete directories and their contents recursively. Required for non-empty directories.

force.description: Set to true to force deletion even if file is read-only. Use with caution.

name: project-explorer_check_outdated
description: Check for outdated npm packages in package.json using 'npm outdated'. Analyzes the current project's dependencies and shows which packages have newer versions available. Requires npm to be installed and accessible from the command line.

projectPath.description: Path to the directory containing package.json. Defaults to the first allowed directory if not specified.

includeDevDependencies.description: Whether to include dev dependencies in the check

outputFormat.description: Format of the output: detailed (full info), summary (counts only), or raw (npm command output)
